discussion_comments.comment_body: Thanks

Sentence-casing needed to indicate that this can be translated:

```suggestion
          "ap-ptp": "Access point",
```
Sorry, slipped my mind
Please change to "User configuration" (sentence-casing in HA)
The unit symbol for liter is a lowercase "l". -> "l/100 km"
Can be replaced with common state: "[%key:common::state::charging%]"
Let's write this out, I have no clue what TM means apart from Trackmania.

> Let's write this out, I have no clue what TM means apart from Trackmania.

is the term that Volvo use to indicate Trip Manual on the car dashboard.
TA is Trip Automatic also on card dashbord.
Even on some other languages they still use the same letters (I have car with Portuguese and they use same letters instead of translating)

Volvo manual: https://www.volvocars.com/uk/support/car/xc40/article/6fb2b9c588370c73c0a801517837d154/

So, what to do here?
Instead of `TM avg. speed` let's write `Trip manual average speed` etc.
Make "URL" and "ID" consistent, using uppercase as in the rest of your strings (and in HA in general).

In Home Assistant sentence-casing is mandatory, so there is a lot to fix in the current strings. E.g. on these lines:

        "description": "Enter your EnergyID webhook provisioning key and secret. Find these in your EnergyID portal under Device Provisioning or Webhook settings. More info: [EnergyID Docs]({docs_url})",
        "data": {
          "provisioning_key": "Provisioning key",
          "provisioning_secret": "Provisioning secret"

For the default UI of Home Assistant we use international English:
```suggestion
          "unsynchronised": "Unsynchronized",
          "grid_consumption": "Grid consumption",
          "grid_injection": "Grid injection",
          "grid_synchronised_but_not_used": "Grid unsynchronized but used"
```

For the UK-English variant the "z" will be replaced with an "s".
All those new strings need to be sentence-cased -> "Local configuration", "One-touch locking", "Sound volume", " Min PIN code length", "Max PIN code length", " Target open-to position"
Fixed. Thanks.

This should be sentence-cased:
-> ` "title": "Sensor options",`

More such strings with missing sentence-casing below.

You might want to use quotes where you reference them in descriptions or error messages so we translators see that these are field labels that need to match in our language.

commented_code:
"xy_state_topic": "The MQTT topic subscribed to receive XY state updates. The expected payload is the X and Y color values separated by commas, for example, `0.675,0.322`. [Learn more.]({url}#xy_state_topic)",

discussion_comments.comment_body:
And for the temperature, too:

```suggestion
                "max_temp": "Maximum temperature",
                "min_temp": "Minimum temperature",
```

I checked the actual translations for `target_temp_high` and `target_temp_low` in `climate`.

Their friendly  names are (since November):
- Upper target temperature
- Lower target temperature

Therefore we should adapt all the strings in `mqtt` to use the same wording.
Starting here:

```suggestion
        "high_low": "Upper/lower target temperature",
```
We can change this option, but I would not recommend changing the other options as it makes it hard to see what the documented option is. So lets keep hose options in terms of high and low.

Hmm, I don't think there is a problem in changing as follows:

"temperature low" -> "lower temperature"
"temperature high" - > "upper temperature"

"target low temperature" -> "lower target temperature"
"target high temperature" - > "upper target temperature"

Would also resolve the inconsistent placement of the adjectives in the two groups.

It is mainly the docs, but we can update those as well.
Do you want to do some suggestions?
OK, I'll go through the strings.
You can use a reference to `"[%key:component::climate::entity_component::_::name%]"` instead.
